Ines, do you know what exactly the problem is and what I'll have to do?

My fault, I forgot to include steps with this bug!

Steps:
- Check out "org.eclipse.ui.tests" and "org.eclipse.test.performance"
- Open "UIComparePreferencesAuto.java"
- Run as "JUnit Plug-In Test"

I have not investigated this bug too deeply, but it seems that the
"DialogCheck#verifyButtonText" throws an assertion failure because the given
button is not large enough to display its text. I believe the button in question
is in Preferences->Workbench->Compare/Patch. Select the "Text Compare" tab. The
"Synchronize scrolling between panes in compare viewers" is the first check box
in that page.
I assume this is not really relevant since the tests do pass.

traces.message: Warning: Button {Synchronize &scrolling between panes in compare viewers}  Actual Width -> 367  Recommended Width -> 380
